column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.One additional coronavirus-related death has been recorded in Northern Ireland on Thursday
column2: bringing the total number of deaths to 2
column3: 149.An additional 99 people have tested positive for Covid-19 following tests on 2
column4: 796 individuals.There were 46 people in hospital with coronavirus as of midnight
column5: three were in intensive care and three were being ventilated.The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Northern Ireland is now 121
column6: 323.Last updated 13 May at 14:30 GMT.The total number of vaccines administered in Northern Ireland is 1
column10: 569 people in Northern Ireland had received one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine
column12: 191 had received two doses.Last updated 13 May at 14:30 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandNo further Covid-19-related deaths were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Thursday
column13: with the country's death toll staying at 4
column14: 937.Another 456 people tested positive for coronavirus.That takes the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in the Republic of Ireland since the pandemic began to 254
column15: 450.There are 111 people with Covid-19 in hospitals in the Republic of Ireland - 36 of them are in intensive care units.Last updated on 13 May at 18:00 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandAs of 11 May
column18: 105 people in the Republic of Ireland had received one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine
column20: 808 people have received two doses.The total number of vaccines administered in the Republic of Ireland is 1
column22: 913.Last updated on 13 May at 18:00 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
